greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of generalized permutations related to the degenerate Eulerian numbers with exactly k ascents (0 <= k <= max(0,n-1)).
link: Orli Herscovici, Generalized permutations related to the degenerate Eulerian numbers, arXiv preprint arXiv:2007.13205 [math.CO], 2020.
formula: T(n,k) = (n+k)*T(n-1,k) + (2*n-k-1)*T(n-1,k-1) for positive integers n and 0 <= k < n; T(0,0)=1 (or T(1,0)=1); otherwise T(n,k)=0.
The following remarks are all conjectures:
The e.g.f. (without the initial 1) A(x,t) = x + (2 + 2*t)*x^2/2! + (6 + 16*t + 6*t^2)*x^3/3! + ... satisfies the autonomous differential equation dA/dx = (1 + A)^2*(1 + t*A)^2.
The series reversion of A(x,t) with respect to x equals Integral_{u = 0..x} 1/((1 + u)^2*(1 + t*u)^2) du.
Let f(x,t) = (1 + x)^2*(1 + t*x)^2 and let D be the operator f(x,t)*d/dx. Then the (n+1)-th row polynomial = D^n(f(x,t)) evaluated at x = 0. (End)
example: Triangle T(n,k) (with rows n >= 0 and columns k = 0..max(0,n-1)) begins:
maple: Tnk[0, 0] := 1; for n to N do

for k from 0 to n do if 0 < k and k < n then Tnk[n, k] := (n + k)*Tnk[n - 1, k] + (2*n - k - 1)*Tnk[n - 1, k - 1]; else if k = 0 then Tnk[n, k] := (n + k)*Tnk[n - 1, k]; else Tnk[n, k] := 0; end if; end if; end do;
xref: Columns k = 0..1 give: A000142, A288964. Row sums give A007559.
results.author: _Orli Herscovici_, Jul 28 2020
